boat.name: Sara
boat.full_description:
Sara's construction is traditional from plywood over frames with single chine plus bulwark strake, SP epoxy adhesives and coatings throughout. Gaff cutter rig with mainsail, staysail, jib and topsail, she has a self draining working cockpit with floor flush throughout, ballast and buoyancy compartments beneath, and cabin top mounted wooden mast.

A Colne Gaffer built in marine ply by Malcolm Goodwin with a Wests treated hull. The gaff cutter rig provides endless fun for family cruising on coastal waters, while the open cockpit layout with small two berth cabin is the perfect boat for day sailing or the occasional night away.

Sara is a great family day sailor!
boat.short_description: Sara is of Wests treated plywood construction. An inshore cruiser with small two berth cabin and large cockpit for day sailing.

for_sales.sales_text: This is your chance to acquire a great family boat. A gaff cutter with a large self-draining cockpit for all the family plus a two berth cabin for the odd night away. Designed and built by Malcolm Goodwin, originally for his own family, Sara is No. 2 in the mini fleet of three. The plywood hull is treated with Wests throughout. It has a steel centreplate and is fun to sail. More like a big dinghy than a cabin cruiser! The full gaff-cutter rig, with topsail, provides endless fun. Now ashore at Brightlingsea for the winter.
